title: Temporarily banning toxic players
body:
I'd say there's at least two trolls a match for me. I just abandoned a match with a troll jg and a troll sup, i couldn't get any cs, he left me for dead twice and kept pushing when i was buying at base. 

People can continue to be cancerous and not worry about it because all they have to do is wait 15 minutes and they can play a match.
That's it? All you have to do is wait a few minutes? Does anyone EVER get banned, even temporarily?

What do you guys think? Should they change the way they deal with a**holes?

replies.body: Yet I still come across them every single match, which indicates it's not working.
Last time i checked Rito had no job openings for fortune tellers and sensitives. They only catch them AFTER they do something bad.
Then they need to buff the ban since people dont care
How do you "buff the ban"? It currently comes in two forms - 14 days or permanent.

The requirements for being banned. I don't see how my opinion is so difficult to understand, in my experience, as well as all my friends, there is a troll every match, which indicates that riot either requires too much to ban them, or simply won't ban them. If the system worked people wouldn't troll at all in fear of not being allowed to play the game.

Well, the point is, they used to do it. But they don't really give a shit about it :/
They just get a lv1 account and troll newbies, who then leave the game. So it actually does more harm than anything...

btw, people with restrictions get banned from ranked until they win a certain number of games, so... maybe that's a better way?
That's not a better way at all. you can still ruin everyone's time but win.
Maybe, although it's a lot harder to win if you get everyone to hate you.

Strange.
I only come across truly toxic people every 20 or so matches.
They've become somewhat of a rarity for me.

Maybe your personality is attracting them in game?

Never got even a warning when I was toxic, no joke.
I look back at my chat and think I really should get banned but not even a warning came up.
When was that? 'Cause if you're talking about more than a few months ago, there was no behaviour system in OCE yet.

It depends what you mean by 'troll' and 'toxic'. People shouldn't be punished for trying to play the game outside of the predefined 1::1:2 setup. It's not 'cancerous' to take creeps, they don't come with labels of ownership. If they leave you with a pushed lane and then leave change to a defensive playstyle and take safe gold you can get. If they complain that you have no damage/tankiness/gold then point out it was their strategy that instigated it. Players should never feel forced to play a certain way, yourself included.

If they intentionally feed or verbally abuse the team then ban them but playing differently or poorly should never be a reason to ban someone.

I'm not saying if you play jungle you own each minion in the jungle, but it's fairly implied as soon as you get into bot lane that the adc is entitled to the majority of the minions. that's not personal playstyle, it's practically a rule of League of Legends. Now the troll supports I'm talking about can take all the farm they want, as long as they don't deliberately push the lane to the tower when the adc is buying something. There's a difference between last hitting and pushing the lane. That just restricts the adc and ruins it late game.

I feel as though players definitely should feel forced to consider the consequences of taking something.

Yeah, right now there's bans for certain categories of players.
It used to be more of a generic response, but it turned out it made low-level games basically unplayable and most players abandoned.
